oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-12-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 14, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ray Price (host/performer), guest performer Patsy Cline, and regular performers Rod Brasfield (recently back from New York making a movie with Zsa Zsa Gabor), Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 950th broadcast, though in fact it is likely the 949th.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl; Patsy Cline; Jordanaires; Stringbean; Ray Price; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ray Price introduces Chet Atkins -- Aunt Dinah's Quilting Party (Chet Atkins) -- Ray Price introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Ray Price) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ray Price introduces Patsy Cline -- I Don't Wanna (Patsy Cline, Jordanaires) -- Ray Price introduces Stringbean -- Going Down The Country (Stringbean) -- Ray Price talks -- Crazy Arms (Ray Price) -- Closing theme (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Closing statement (Ray Price) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner) -- Noel Hotel commercial (Grant Turner) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Jackson, Tommy; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Cline, Patsy, 1932-1963
